file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-60-07-06 - ESCAPE ROPE - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ESCAPE ROPE - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the inspection/check of the escape ropes. B. The escape ropes are installed in the cockpit, in zones 225 and 226. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 25-60-07-200-801-A ♦ ESCAPE ROPE - INSPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-60-07 Page 1 of 5 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-60-07-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ESCAPE ROPE - INSPECTION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to inspect the escape ropes. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 225BLC Cockpit LH 226 226BRC Cockpit RH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit RH/Cockpit LH I. Cockpit Escape Rope - GVI (Figure 401) SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) NOTE: Do the same procedures to inspect the escape ropes on the LH and RH sides of the cockpit. Open the access panels 225BLC and/or the 226BRC to get the access to the escape ropes ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (2) Remove the bolt (1), washer (2) and bushing (4) that attach the escape rope (3). (3) Remove the escape rope (3). (4) Fully extend the escape rope (3) and make sure of the conditions that follow: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 25-60-07 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) The escape rope (3) has no kinks, nicks, frayed parts, loose stitches, or other damage. (b) The escape rope (3) does not rub on the adjacent structure. (5) Examine the box for cracks or other damage. (6) At the attach points bolt (1), washer (2), and bushing (4) of the escape rope (3), make sure of the conditions that follow: (a) The metal at the attach points has no corrosion, wear, damage, and cracks. (7) Tighten the bolt (1), washer (2), and bushing (4) that attach the escape rope (3). (8) Arrange the escape rope as shown in steps 1 thru 4. Keep it in the cockpit housing as shown in step 5. (9) Close the access panels 225BLC and/or 226BRC ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 25-60-07 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
